verses.text: 那些制定奸惡律例的，和那些記錄詭詐判語的，有禍了！

words.note: Often refers to divine or legal codes in the Bible.
Frequently describes deceptive practices in the Bible.
Refers to legal or divine pronouncements.
A common prophetic declaration of impending disaster.

verses.text: 他們想藉此屈枉窮乏人的公義，剝奪我子民中困苦人的權利，使寡婦作了他們的掠物，使孤兒作了他們的擄物。

words.note: Often used regarding perverting justice in scripture.
Refers to the materially needy, a frequent subject in the Bible.
A core concept in biblical ethics and theology.
Often refers to God's chosen people or a nation's populace.
Similar to 'poor people' but emphasizes suffering and hardship.
Widows and orphans are often mentioned together as vulnerable groups.
Often used for spoils of war or unjust taking.
Orphans and widows are frequently highlighted as vulnerable in scripture.
Similar to '掠物', often refers to things taken from captives.

verses.text: 到降罰的日子，有災禍從遠方來到，那時你們要怎樣行呢？你們可以向誰逃奔求助呢？你們可以把你們的財寶撇在哪裡呢？
你們只能屈身在被擄的人中間，或是仆倒在被殺的人中間。雖然這樣，耶和華的怒氣還沒有轉消，他的手仍然伸出。

words.note: Implies submission or defeat.
Often describes being struck down or killed.
The covenant name of God in the Old Testament.
Often refers to anger or wrath subsiding.

verses.text: 神懲治子民的工具亞述啊！我怒氣的棍子，有禍了。他們手中拿著我忿怒的杖。

words.note: Often written with a space or raised to show reverence.
Often refers to God's chosen people or a nation's populace.
Symbolic of authority or punishment in the Bible.
A prophetic declaration of doom, here directed at Assyria.
Similar to 怒氣, often refers to divine anger.
Symbolic of authority, support, or discipline.

verses.heading: The Lord Turns on Arrogant Assyria

verses.text: 我要差派他去攻擊一個不敬虔的國，吩咐他去攻擊我惱怒的子民，擄去掠物，搶奪擄物，把他們踐踏，像街上的泥土一樣。

words.note: Combined with '不' (not) to mean 'ungodly'.
Refers to the people of a nation or ruler.
Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.

verses.text: 但亞述並沒有這樣想過，他心裡也沒有這樣打算；他心裡倒想毀滅、剪除多國。

words.note: Used with '不' or '沒' to emphasize negation.
Indicates a past experience.

verses.text: 因為他說：「在我手下的眾領袖不都是王嗎？
迦勒挪不是像迦基米施嗎？哈瑪不是像亞珥拔嗎？撒瑪利亞不是像大馬士革嗎？
我的手伸展到這些充滿偶像的國，他們雕刻的像比耶路撒冷和撒瑪利亞的還多。
我怎樣對待撒瑪利亞和其中的偶像，不也照樣對待耶路撒冷和其中的偶像嗎？」
主在錫安山和耶路撒冷成全了他一切工作的時候，他必說：我要懲罰亞述王自大的心所結的果子，和他眼目高傲的態度。

words.note: Refers to the specific office/person leading Assyria.
Indicates the following verb is the agent of the action.

verses.text: 因為他說：「我靠著我手的能力和我的智慧行事，因為我很聰明；我挪移了列國的地界，搶奪了他們積蓄的財寶，並且我像個勇士般使他們的居民全都俯伏下來。

words.note: Combines with preceding verb to indicate direction or completion.

verses.text: 我的手伸到列國的財寶那裡，好像抓到鳥窩一樣；我取得了全地，好像人拾起被棄的雀蛋；沒有動翅膀的，沒有張嘴的，也沒有鳴叫的。」

words.note: Turns a verb or clause into a noun phrase, e.g., 'the one who...'
Turns a verb or clause into a noun phrase, e.g., 'the one who...'
Turns a verb or clause into a noun phrase, e.g., 'the one who...'

verses.text: 斧頭怎可以向用斧頭砍木的人自誇呢？鋸子怎可以向拉鋸的人自大呢？好比棍能揮動那舉起棍的，又好比杖舉起那不是木頭的。

words.note: Turns a verb or clause into a noun phrase, e.g., 'the one who...'
Turns a verb or clause into a noun phrase, e.g., 'the one who...'
Turns a verb or clause into a noun phrase, e.g., 'the one who...'
Turns a verb or clause into a noun phrase, e.g., 'the one who...'

verses.text: 因此，主萬軍之耶和華必打發令人消瘦的病臨到亞述王肥壯的軍人中間，在他的榮耀之下必燃起火燄，如同火燒一樣。

words.note: A common title for God in the Bible.
Part of the title 'Lord of Hosts'.
Classical Chinese possessive particle, equivalent to modern '的'.
Classical way of saying 'below' or 'underneath'.

verses.text: 以色列的光必變成火，他的聖者必成為火燄；在一日之間把亞述王的荊棘和蒺藜焚燒與吞滅。

words.note: Refers to God or a holy person in a religious context.
More formal than '和'.

verses.text: 又把他樹林和豐盛果園的榮美全部滅盡，包括靈魂和身體，好像一個患病的人漸漸虛弱一樣。
他林中剩下的樹，數目必定稀少，連小孩子也能把它們的數目寫下來。
到那日，以色列的餘民和雅各家逃脫的人，必不再倚靠那擊打他們的，卻要誠實地倚靠耶和華以色列的聖者。

words.note: Refers to a specific future day, often a day of judgment or salvation.
Refers to the descendants or lineage of Jacob.

verses.text: 那些餘民，就是雅各家的餘民，必回轉歸向大能的 神。

words.note: Refers to a surviving group, often with religious significance.
Refers to a surviving group, often with religious significance.
Often indicates strong certainty or determination.
In religious contexts, often implies repentance.
Often used in the sense of turning to God.
Frequently used to describe God's power.
Capitalized '神' refers to the one God in many Bible translations.

verses.text: 以色列啊！你的人民雖然像海沙那樣多，卻只有餘剩的人可以歸回，因為滅絕的事已經定了，公義必如洪水氾濫。

words.note: Figurative language for countless numbers.
Indicates a turn or contrast in meaning.
Refers to a complete eradication.
A key theological term referring to God's character and actions.
Often indicates strong certainty or determination.
More literary than 像 (xiàng).
Often used for natural disasters or uncontrolled spread.

verses.text: 主萬軍之耶和華必在全地之中，作成已定的毀滅之事。

words.note: Refers to God or Christ as master.
Used in the title 'Lord of Hosts' (萬軍之耶和華).
Classical Chinese particle, similar to '的'.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Often indicates strong certainty or determination.
A more formal or literary way to say 'in the middle of'.
Implies a divine decree or prophecy.
Classical Chinese particle, connects an adjective to a noun or nominalizes a verb phrase.

verses.text: 因此，主萬軍之耶和華這樣說：「我的子民、錫安的居民哪！亞述人雖然用棍擊打你們，又像埃及一樣舉杖攻擊你們，你們卻不要怕他們。

words.note: Refers to God or Christ as master.
Used in the title 'Lord of Hosts' (萬軍之耶和華).
Classical Chinese particle, similar to '的'.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Refers to God's chosen people.
Refers to Jerusalem or its people.
Implies an act of aggression or authority.
Indicates a turn or contrast in meaning.

verses.text: 因為還有短暫的時候，我向你們發的惱怒就要完結，我的怒氣要轉向他們，使他們滅亡。」

words.note: Part of the phrase '發的惱怒' (the wrath I expressed).
Often refers to divine anger or indignation.
Refers to a surge of anger, often divine.
Refers to complete destruction or demise.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華必興起鞭子攻擊他們，好像在俄立磐石那裡擊殺米甸人一樣；他的杖要伸到海上，他必把杖舉起，像在埃及一樣。

words.note: A divine title meaning 'God of armies/powers'.
A Midianite prince, slain by Gideon.

words.definition: on the sea, to the sea

words.note: Introduces object before verb for emphasis.

verses.text: 到那日，亞述人的重壓必從你們的肩頭上挪開，他們的軛必離開你們的頸項；那軛必因肥壯的緣故折斷。

words.note: Locative suffix indicating 'on top of'.
Refers to the strength or prosperity that causes the yoke to break.

verses.text: 亞述人來到亞葉，經過米磯崙；在密抹存放軍隊行裝。
他們過了隘口，在迦巴住宿；拉瑪人戰兢，掃羅的基比亞人逃跑。
迦琳的居民哪，高聲叫喊吧！萊煞人和可憐的亞拿突啊，留心聽吧！

words.note: Indicates suggestion or exhortation.
Indicates suggestion or exhortation.

verses.text: 瑪得米那人逃跑，基柄的居民避難。
就在今日，亞述王要停留在挪伯；他要揮拳攻擊錫安居民（「居民」原文作「女子」）的山，就是耶路撒冷的山。
看哪！主萬軍之耶和華在可怕的震撼聲中，把樹枝削去；身量高的必被砍下，高大的必被伐倒。

words.note: Often used in biblical texts to draw attention.
Refers to God or Jesus in biblical context.
A divine title signifying God's sovereignty over all creation.
Often used in biblical texts for certainty or divine will.
Often used in biblical texts for certainty or divine will.

verses.text: 樹林中的密叢，他必用鐵器砍下；黎巴嫩的樹木必被大能者伐倒。

words.note: Often used in biblical texts for certainty or divine will.
Often used in biblical texts for certainty or divine will.
Often refers to God or a divinely powerful figure in scripture.
